subject: Economics
title: Property Rights: Why Your Title Deed Matters
description: A micro-lesson that makes Property Rights: Why Your Title Deed Matters usable.

hook.text: In Peru, 70% of urban property has no legal title.

buildup.text: Hernando de Soto called this 'dead capital': assets that exist physically but not legally.

discovery.text: De Soto estimated $9.3 trillion of dead capital in the developing world â€” more than 20x all foreign aid ever given.

twist.text: But titling alone isn't magic. Ethiopia titled 20 million plots and investment barely changed.

climax.text: Property rights require more than paper.

punchline.text: Your house isn't wealth until the law says it is.

quiz.question: What is 'dead capital' according to Hernando de Soto?
options: Assets like homes that exist physically but lack legal titles, preventing them from being used as collateral or traded in markets
Money in bank accounts that's not invested
